sub_topic: Calculation of Carnot efficiency of a heat engine
message_1: A heat engine operates between two reservoirs at temperatures 800 K and 300 K. What is the Carnot efficiency of this heat engine?
message_2:
The Carnot efficiency of a heat engine is given by the formula:

Efficiency = 1 - (T_cold / T_hot)

where T_cold is the temperature of the cold reservoir and T_hot is the temperature of the hot reservoir. The temperatures must be in the same unit, such as Kelvin (K).

In this case, T_hot = 800 K and T_cold = 300 K. Plugging these values into the formula, we get:

Efficiency = 1 - (300 K / 800 K) = 1 - 0.375 = 0.625

So, the Carnot efficiency of this heat engine is 0.625 or 62.5%.
